S7 class: secureguard

Source: R/guardrail.R
secureguard_class.Rd

An S7 value type representing a guardrail. Prefer the guard_*() factory functions for end-user guardrails.

Usage

secureguard_class(
  name = character(0),
  type = character(0),
  check_fn = function() NULL,
  description = character(0)
)

Arguments

name

Character(1). Short identifier for the guardrail.

type

Character(1). One of "input", "code", or "output".

check_fn

A function taking a single argument and returning a guardrail_result().

description

Character(1). Human-readable description.

Value

An S7 object of class secureguard.

Examples

# Prefer new_guardrail() or guard_*() factories over direct construction
g <- secureguard_class(
  name = "my_guard",
  type = "input",
  check_fn = function(x) guardrail_result(pass = TRUE),
  description = "A simple guardrail"
)
g@name
#> [1] "my_guard"
g@type
#> [1] "input"
